column4: I tried to install ubuntu 6.06 amd64 version on a Dell with Pentium D.  Install completes successfully and grub loads fine, but when ubuntu is booting, it stalls at "Running local boot scripts".  Anyone have any idea what I can do?
try rebooting and booting in safe mode, by hitting Esc when GRUB is loading
did booting in safe mode give any further insight?
what exactly should I have been looking for?  the local script was all comments except for EXIT 0
it's a fresh install, not an upgrade
strange. booting in safe mode should have given you more text to read, which might have helped narrow down the issue.
there were no problems when booting in safe mode.
the other thing you could try is to disable acpi when the machine boots.  You'd also do this in GRUB.
oh really? booted fully to login prompt?
very interesting. desktop or server install?
no, just curious. usually desktop loads more stuff
actually to be more specific it has [ Ok ]  for the "Running local boot scripts" and then it stalls
with the forums down, i can't really help much other than to say boot into safe mode and keep digging
